I think Rabies (etc.) varient [2] is most likely. Between suppression by armed forces and personal fortification, I don\'t think it would really get out of control. People who go rushing into the streets to buy food to hoard/yell about how the government isn\'t reacting fast enough to the crisis/break open shopfronts to steal things in the confusion are more likely to get bitten than those who follow the newsreader\'s instructions and stay indoors. Provided government remains intact, or at the very least Cabinet Office Briefing Room A [COBRA] (The British government\'s emergency council), phone lines, Internet, radios, TVs and the power grid should all continue to function. Have an injury? Call 999 like you would normally and an airambulance or military airlift helicopter comes to your aid.

More annoyingly, news helicopters would probably hover over people who have put signs like \'SOS\' and \'HELP!\' on their roofs only to be stared at and broadcasted over the nation by some guy who may well have a more secure chance of surviving the disaster.

\'Dawn of the dead\' style zombies aren\'t caused by an infection-anyone who dies becomes one.
